intro: Buchanania florida var. cumingii, commonly known as the white-flowered Buchanania, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
